Articles.Content:
Anyone know what is causing this crash? Is it just a memory issue or what is mono.dll? 

Unity Player [version: Unity 4.6.4f1\_99f88340878d]

mono.dll caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)

 in module mono.dll at 0023:1011940a.

Error occurred at 2015-05-14\_191406.

C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program\KSP.exe, run by Bolverker.

35% memory in use.

0 MB physical memory [0 MB free].

0 MB paging file [0 MB free].

0 MB user address space [111 MB free].

Write to location 01000000 caused an access violation.

Context:

EDI: 0x00800000 ESI: 0xd0bfb338 EAX: 0x00020000

EBX: 0x59cc55d0 ECX: 0x01000000 EDX: 0x00000000

EIP: 0x1011940a EBP: 0x00f60304 SegCs: 0x00000023

EFlags: 0x00010206 ESP: 0x00f602e0 SegSs: 0x0000002b

Bytes at CS:EIP:

66 0f 7f 01 66 0f 7f 41 10 66 0f 7f 41 20 66 0f

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-15T22:45:56Z" title="05/15/2015 10:45  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 15, 2015</time> by Bolverker**

I'm having this exact same problem. Happens mostly when going to or from the flight scene. Almost always when reverting to hangar or recovering a flight after a revert to pad/runway.

I've gone through and tested it with and with out my mods to no pay out. Any work around would be nice.
[No logs, no help](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92229-How-To-Get-Support-%28READ-FIRST%29). Besides, that looks a lot like a memory crash.

> 
> [No logs, no help](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92229-How-To-Get-Support-%28READ-FIRST%29). Besides, that looks a lot like a memory crash.

it was. work around detailed here.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121313-Memory-Waste-Problem](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121313-Memory-Waste-Problem)
Mono.dll gave me a access violation. I made sure there were no duplicates of anything and mono.dll was happy (Mono means one. It makes sure there is only one of each file)

> 
> 
> 8 hours ago, Firefox101 said:
> 
> 
> Mono.dll gave me a access violation. I made sure there were no duplicates of anything and mono.dll was happy (Mono means one. It makes sure there is only one of each file)
> 

That's incorrect. Mono is the name of the code base that Unity is built on (and Unity is the engine that KSP is built on). You can read all about it at [http://www.mono-project.com](http://www.mono-project.com). A mono.dll crash means you have outdated mods. Also, proper procedure is to open a new thread for your problems, not post on a 2.5 year old one.

Having the same problem to. Here are two sets of logs from different different attempts to launch.  It's throwing an access violation. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") Hope the logs help!

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/l8k4hpac6mfx2lu/2017-09-30_161830.zip?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/l8k4hpac6mfx2lu/2017-09-30_161830.zip?dl=0)

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/pqpxq966e6wr0q3/2017-09-30_162248.zip?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/pqpxq966e6wr0q3/2017-09-30_162248.zip?dl=0)

> 
> 
> On 15.5.2015 at 6:08 AM, Bolverker said:
> 
> 
> KSP.exe,
> 

Use the 64 bit executable.

> 
> 
> 11 hours ago, JonathanS223 said:
> 
> 
> Having the same problem to.
> 

Outdated mods.
Bump....same problem. If any moderator can plz place it in right section it'll be really kind. N blame Google not the necromancer.

> 
> 
> 21 minutes ago, LuciferZ25 said:
> 
> 
> Bump....same problem. If any moderator can plz place it in right section it'll be really kind. N blame Google not the necromancer.
> 

The reason will be still the same: outdated mod(s) ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

It's  <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr>. It's updated. Yet it ctd. I'll roll back n let roverdude know. It's weird but true. <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">Kas</abbr> is the problem with update.
